final_answer.precision_note: Kc reported as dimensionless (unitless) as specified in the report. Result given to 3 significant figures based on the equilibrium mole values.

method: First, calculate equilibrium concentrations in the 2.00 dm3 vessel. [NO2] = moles/volume = 0.180 mol / 2.00 dm3 = 0.0900 mol dm-3. [N2O4] = moles/volume = 0.220 mol / 2.00 dm3 = 0.110 mol dm-3. Using the equilibrium expression for N2O4(g) â†” 2NO2(g): Kc = [NO2]^2 / [N2O4]. Substituting: Kc = (0.0900)^2 / 0.110 = 0.00810 / 0.110 = 0.0736. Kc is reported as dimensionless as specified in the report.
checks: Kc < 1 indicates equilibrium lies to the left (towards N2O4), consistent with higher moles of N2O4 (0.220 mol) than NO2 (0.180 mol)
Concentration units (mol dm-3) cancel in the Kc expression, giving a dimensionless value
The stoichiometry shows 2 moles of NO2 for every 1 mole of N2O4 at equilibrium
